alert.note: Alert for Ruby Mountains and East Humboldt Range; South Central Elko County; Southwest Elko County; White Pine County (Nevada) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued September 03 at 3:48PM PDT by NWS Elko
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northwestern White Pine and south central Elko Counties through 415 PM PDT... At 347 PM PDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 14 miles southwest of Ruby Lake, moving north at 35 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Heavy Rainfall along with gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This storm will remain over mainly rural areas of northwestern White Pine and south central Elko Counties. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 800 PM PDT for northeastern Nevada.

area.areaDesc: Ruby Mountains and East Humboldt Range; South Central Elko County; Southwest Elko County; White Pine County
